messages.subject: Re: NE conference
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/28/2003 5:38:18 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... North Shore of Boston. I m in Salem, to be specific, but there s LOTS not too far from me,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/28/2003 5:38:18 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> We already know it would be better NOT right in Boston. Also, helpful to be
> near a major airport. To tell the truth, if I am doing the major
> coordinating, it needs to be not too far from where I am.
>
> Where are you??
>
>

North Shore of Boston. I'm in Salem, to be specific, but there's LOTS "not
too far from me," including Southern NH.

SandraDodd@... writes:
Something that requires rental cars might be more expensive than hotel rooms,

overall.  And not just overall, but for individuals who might come from far
away.
Then again, you could try to just do something for driving families and not
those who would have to fly.  That's no more "unfair" than an airport hotel
would be to a family just a few miles away who wanted to drive and camp.

True...Frankly, ALL of New England ain't that big, and anyone coming WOULD
drive or something. And if we got any speakers from away, we could certainly
pick them up.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
